intro: Lasthenia chrysantha, commonly known as the golden foothills globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and fuzzy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, round seed capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
